intro: Manotes asiatica, commonly known as the Asian manroot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and striking, arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are typically enclosed in a spathe. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
